content.raw:
I couldn't get it to work until I've installed jsdoc and added it's path to the grunt file according to their documentation

``` jsdoc: (optional) the path to the jsdoc bin (needed only for some border line cases) ```

Can you try it to see if that border line case config of mine would work for you?.
content.html:
I couldn't get it to work until I've installed jsdoc and added it's path to the grunt file according to their documentation

jsdoc: (optional) the path to the jsdoc bin (needed only for some border line cases)

Can you try it to see if that border line case config of mine would work for you?.

pull_request.title: Replace bash scripts with npm ones

pullrequest.title: Replace bash scripts with npm ones

content.raw:
I had to install some extra dependencies to get it to work, here's the diff:

~~~
diff -r 40af1b370f0b gz3d/utils/package.json
--- a/gz3d/utils/package.json	Thu Sep 14 05:19:00 2017 +0200
+++ b/gz3d/utils/package.json	Wed Sep 20 09:24:58 2017 -0700
@@ -1,18 +1,19 @@
 {
   "name": "gzweb-dev",
   "description": "gzweb build environment setup",
-  "repository" :
-  {
-    "type" : "mercurial",
-    "url" : "#!/osrf/gzweb"
+  "repository": {
+    "type": "mercurial",
+    "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
   "devDependencies": {
+    "catharsis": "^0.8.9",
     "grunt": "~0.4.1",
+    "grunt-contrib-clean": "~0.4.0",
     "grunt-contrib-concat": "~0.1.3",
     "grunt-contrib-jshint": "~0.1.1",
+    "grunt-contrib-uglify": "~0.2.0",
     "grunt-contrib-watch": "~0.3.1",
-    "grunt-contrib-uglify": "~0.2.0",
     "grunt-jsdoc": "~0.3.0",
-    "grunt-contrib-clean": "~0.4.0"
+    "taffydb": "^2.7.3"
   }
 }
~~~

What I did:

~~~
cd gz3d/utils
npm install --save-dev taffydb
npm install --save-dev catharsis
cd ../..
npm run docs
firefox gz3d/doc/index.html 
~~~
content.html:
I had to install some extra dependencies to get it to work, here's the diff:

diff -r 40af1b370f0b gz3d/utils/package.json
--- a/gz3d/utils/package.json   Thu Sep 14 05:19:00 2017 +0200
+++ b/gz3d/utils/package.json   Wed Sep 20 09:24:58 2017 -0700
@@ -1,18 +1,19 @@
 {
   "name": "gzweb-dev",
   "description": "gzweb build environment setup",
-  "repository" :
-  {
-    "type" : "mercurial",
-    "url" : "#!/osrf/gzweb"
+  "repository": {
+    "type": "mercurial",
+    "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
   "devDependencies": {
+    "catharsis": "^0.8.9",
     "grunt": "~0.4.1",
+    "grunt-contrib-clean": "~0.4.0",
     "grunt-contrib-concat": "~0.1.3",
     "grunt-contrib-jshint": "~0.1.1",
+    "grunt-contrib-uglify": "~0.2.0",
     "grunt-contrib-watch": "~0.3.1",
-    "grunt-contrib-uglify": "~0.2.0",
     "grunt-jsdoc": "~0.3.0",
-    "grunt-contrib-clean": "~0.4.0"
+    "taffydb": "^2.7.3"
   }
 }

What I did:

cd gz3d/utils
npm install --save-dev taffydb
npm install --save-dev catharsis
cd ../..
npm run docs
firefox gz3d/doc/index.html

pullrequest.title: Replace bash scripts with npm ones

content.raw:
The only information that we lost here is this warning msg in case the deploy script wan't run
```
if [ ! -d http/client ]
then
   echo "gzweb not initialized, have you run ./deploy.sh yet?"
```
If this message is important, we can modify the start script to be 
```  "start": "echo 'Make sure you run ./deploy.sh to initialize gzweb' & ./node_modules/.bin/http-server -p $npm_package_config_port http/client & cd gzbridge && ./ws_server.js"
```

I think it would be a good idea to call the ```deploy.sh``` script form npm, we can do that in a later PR.
content.html:
The only information that we lost here is this warning msg in case the deploy script wan't run

if [ ! -d http/client ]
then
   echo "gzweb not initialized, have you run ./deploy.sh yet?"

If this message is important, we can modify the start script to be "start": "echo 'Make sure you run ./deploy.sh to initialize gzweb' & ./node_modules/.bin/http-server -p $npm_package_config_port http/client & cd gzbridge && ./ws_server.js"

I think it would be a good idea to call the deploy.sh script form npm, we can do that in a later PR.
